As much as I hope you're right, what makes you think it's monthly till the end of the year and only a couple-month hiatus? It's been quite the opposite for the past way-to-long.

If memory serves me right, Miura has some of the more general plot-points planned out beforehand but he fills in the details as he goes along. For example, he knew he wanted Guts to be angry and impassioned with hate, so he went with it. The Band of the Hawk and the romantic plot with Casca weren't planned, rather, they were a sort of whimsical inclusion which fit the original hate-filled protagonist theme well.
Miura just happens to be exceptionally good at this writing style. That's not to say that it's flawless; the first panel in Berserk which shows Guts sex'ing a demon is *very* out of character for him given the backstory which was subsequently developed.
